thread.title: Slaven Bilic would welcome retired Frank Lampard back to West Ham as a coach
thread.title_full: Slaven Bilic would welcome retired Frank Lampard back to West Ham as a coach

author: leeastley
title: Slaven Bilic would welcome retired Frank Lampard back to West Ham as a coach
text:
Bil's Frank offer Slaven Bilic would welcome retired Frank Lampard back to West Ham as a coach 
Bilic says the midfielder - who has now turned his attention to getting his coaching badges - is the perfect role model for young players By BEN HUNT Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments SLAVEN BILIC will welcome Frank Lampard back to West Ham with open arms if he wants to join his coaching team. 
Lampard called time on his glittering career yesterday and then switched his attention towards getting his coaching badges. EPA Frank Lampard called time on his glittering 21-year career yesterday West Ham 0-4 Manchester City : An easy night at the London Stadium for City 
Keep up to date with ALL the West Ham news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
He said: "Frank is always very welcome in our club and I am sure he will be like he was in his football career and will be serious in his managerial career. 
"People talk about legends and it is a common word, but he is one of the ambassadors. One of the legends of the Premier League. PA:Press Association Frank Lampard began his career at West Ham before moving to Chelsea in 2001 related stories Arsenal bad boy Granit Xhaka slammed over red card record by Switzerland legend Kubilay Turkyilmaz keeper woe Manchester United goalkeeper blow as Joel Pereira suffers serious knee ligament injury in training mummy's boy Manchester City have their guardian angel in Gabriel Jesus... but he still needs his mum to escort him CLEAR OUT Ian Ayre to leave Liverpool at the end of the month as Reds continue major restructure of hierarchy Greiz a crowd Manchester United will sell Rooney, Martial and Fellaini to make funds for Â£100m Antoine Griezmann BIG KICK-OFF Leicester City vs Man Utd: What time is kick-off, latest team news and SunSport score prediction News Group Newspapers Ltd 3 Slaven Bilic says he would welcome Frank Lampard back to West Ham as a coach 
"I remember when he started his career here at West Ham and I use his example many times during my spells as a manager in Croatia, Russia, Turkey and here. 
"What he achieved is purely unbelievable and he kept his feet on the ground. He is a gentleman and top player. 
"He did not rely only on his talent. I remember him staying after every session -- not once a week - he was having shooting practice and doing shuttle runs to improve. 
"He is maybe the greatest example to show youngster of what you have to do to be successful." Chelsea legend Frank Lampard sees comeback bid derailed - by his cute dog Minnie
